The US economy grew last quarter at its </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/28/us-gross-domestic-product-increases-at-2point0percent-annualized-pace-in-q3-vs-2point8percent-estimate.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">slowest pace</a></span><span> since the beginning of the recovery last summer—2% annualized. <div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/undefined?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Could It Have Been Anything Else?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/undefined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt='Mark Zuckerberg standing in front of a poster that says "Meta"' style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2fcafb9c30836538f9c668bcad0708ce51123633-1873x1054.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Facebook </em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">At Facebook’s Connect event yesterday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the corporation will <a href="https://apnews.com/article/facebook-meta-mark-zuckerberg-technology-business-5ad543ab7780caae435935f0aca9fac6?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">switch its name</a> to Meta. Why? Because calling the company Facebook is like calling Rihanna a musician—it just doesn’t work anymore.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Right now, our brand is so tightly linked with one product that it can’t possibly represent everything we’re doing today, let alone in the future,” Zuck said.</span></li></ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Meta is short for metaverse</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Which has been described by Zuck as “the next chapter of the internet.” The metaverse is a complex topic to describe, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/mark-zuckerberg-wants-facebook-become-metaverse-company-mean?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">even for experts</a>, but roughly speaking it’s a world where people work, shop, play, and do everything else they normally do IRL—just in digital form.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And if the metaverse is the next chapter of the internet, Zuck wants to write it and leave everyone else in the footnotes.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Meta (slowly getting used to it) is separating out its “Reality Labs” unit, which is home to Oculus and other virtual reality products. The other unit is the Family of Apps (WhatsApp, Instagram, etc.).</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company is spending so much on the metaverse—like hiring 10,000 jobs in Europe to work on it—that its operating profits will take a $10 billion hit this year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">How you know it’s real:</strong> Meta is giving up its ticker FB and going with MVRS on Dec. 1.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Critics say this is an intentional distraction</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Companies throughout history have rebranded when facing public pressure. In 2003, cigarette maker Philip Morris changed its name to Altria to try and shed its reputation as a public health menace.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for Facebook, you could name it Orange Juice Squared and it would still be facing the same threats, such as a recent onslaught of critical reports, Apple’s privacy changes denting its ad business, and, perhaps most significantly, decreasing popularity among young people.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, Facebook’s problems are Meta’s problems.—<em>NF</em></p>
</div>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/the-white-house-released-a-new-smaller-framework-for-building-back-better?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The New Spending Bill: What's In, What's Out
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The White House on Thursday rolled out a new, personal pan-sized framework for its Build Back Better Act—a spending package that aims to pump heaps of cash into climate, social welfare, and educational programs.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Initially eyeing a $6 trillion price tag, then $3.5 trillion, Democrats corralled by President Biden have cut the package down to $1.75 trillion after an arduous stretch of negotiations with <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2021/10/27/twitter-amplifies-conservative-politicians/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">most-likely-to-be-ratioed</a> Senators Manchin and Sinema. But, contrary to popular belief: The bill does still contain words. So what does Building Back Better currently look like?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s in:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">An additional year </strong></span><span>of the enhanced child tax credit.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Universal pre-K </strong></span><span>for more than 6 million 3- and 4-year-olds.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Environmental tax credits</strong></span><span> of up to $12,500 for new electric vehicles and incentives for installing solar panels.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s out:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Paid family and medical leave.</strong></span><span> Initially 12 weeks were floated, but the proposal has now been entirely cut.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Two free years of community college.</strong></span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Prescription drug price decreases.</strong></span><span> Previous versions of the bill would’ve allowed Medicare to negotiate drug prices.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><strong style="color:#000">Medicare dental</strong></span><span> and vision coverage.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/26/undefined?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Billionaires Income Tax</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s next: </strong>Democrats need to receive support from their own caucus to pass the bill in the Senate. House progressives have “enthusiastically endorsed” the new White House framework.—<em>MK</em></p>
</div>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CLIMATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/big-oil-execs-deny-spreading-climate-disinformation-in-washington?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Big Oil to a House Committee
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/big-oil-execs-deny-spreading-climate-disinformation-in-washington?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Greg talking to Kendall in Succession, " I-I'm kinda too honest to be in Congress so much"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/9d2a83692123217fcee43c2bcb749f6a26da296f-720x400.png?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>HBO</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Never a good day when people are comparing you to the tobacco industry. The heads of six big fossil fuel companies and trade groups <a href="https://apnews.com/article/climate-science-business-environment-and-nature-campaigns-cf3524fd23854d2c2df2d3294dd58134?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testified</a> before Congress yesterday, which some politicians said was reminiscent of the infamous 1994 hearing in which tobacco execs said they didn’t think nicotine was addictive.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This time, just replace spreading nicotine disinformation with climate disinformation.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The energy bosses don’t agree with that comparison.</strong> ExxonMobil CEO Darren Woods denied allegations that the company intentionally spread disinformation about fossil fuels' contribution to global warming.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px"><li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Exxon is still trying to break out of the villain role after a </span><span><a href="https://www.channel4.com/news/revealed-exxonmobils-lobbying-war-on-climate-change-legislation?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">video</a></span><span> was released in July of a company lobbyist admitting to using shady strategies to stop climate legislation.</span>
</li></ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Execs from BP, Chevron, Shell, The American Petroleum Institute, and the US Chamber of Commerce followed Woods’s lead during the hearing and said they also didn’t do anything wrong.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture:</strong> Energy companies are getting squeezed by lawmakers <em>and </em>shareholders about their lackluster transition to renewable resources. Shell is currently in a <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/shell-aims-to-halve-carbon-emissions-by-2030-as-activist-calls-for-breakup-11635409750?mod=hp_lead_pos7" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spat</a> with an activist investor who wants to break up the company.—<em>MM</em></p>
</div>

TOGETHER WITH MISO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Some robots say boring stuff like “beep boop beep bop” and “battery low.” Allow us to introduce you to a different type of robot.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A robot who says “oui, chef.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oh oui, Miso Robotics’ <a href="https://invest.misorobotics.com/?utm_source=rgamisolandingpage&utm_medium=partmb1029&utm_campaign=partmb1029&tnames=partmb1029" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">autonomous robot kitchen assistants</a> perform tasks such as grilling and frying alongside chefs in commercial kitchens. These bots are currently working with <strong style="color:#000">10 of the top 25 brands in the QSR industry, with dozens of pilot programs along the way</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Miso just announced its latest partnership with <strong style="color:#000">Inspire Brands</strong>, parent company of Buffalo Wild Wings, called Flippy Wings. This robotic frying solution is forecasted to increase food production speeds by 10-20%.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Furthermore, unconfirmed rumors indicate that these robot cooks also use extremely expensive hair gel and eat baguettes whilst disrupting the <strong style="color:#000">$273B food service industry.</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Right now is the </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>final month</em></strong><strong style="color:#000"> to invest in Miso’s robot cooks</strong>. <a href="https://invest.misorobotics.com/?utm_source=rgamisolandingpage&utm_medium=partmb1029&utm_campaign=partmb1029&tnames=partmb1029" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Click here to get in on the action</a>.</p>
</td>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/key-performance-indicators-october-29?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/key-performance-indicators-october-29?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="BJ Novak" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/aef3d3bc3552fb1fc212613a5bd944ad83fccd58-1024x717.jpg?w=670&q=70&auto=format">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>B. J. Novak (Rodin Eckenroth/WireImage)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<div>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote:</strong> “I am too amused to do anything about it.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>The Office </em>star B.J. Novak is <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/27/business/bj-novak-photo-public-domain-products.html?partner=slack&smid=sl-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">truly chillin’</a> after finding out his headshot entered the public domain a few years ago and has been used on everything from Uruguayan face paint to Chinese electric razors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Here is a trifecta of interesting stats from a <a href="https://www.kff.org/coronavirus-covid-19/poll-finding/kff-covid-19-vaccine-monitor-october-2021/?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new vaccine survey</a> by the Kaiser Family Foundation.</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>5% of unvaccinated workers say they left a job because of a vaccine requirement.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than one-third of unvaccinated workers said they would leave their job if their employer required a vaccine or weekly test.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>25% of workers said their employer is requiring them to get vaccines, up from 9% in June.</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>It’s never too late to climb that mountain. (<a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/10/26/sports/alex-honnold-mother-el-capitan.html?unlocked_article_code=AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAACEIPuonUktbfqohlSFUZBSbORd89sgbBjPzC0Pk8gXn4KyyZDDNF0-QYGc2N_wLGbLJie9I1mTSHQdsLeJkeeMtP9M4NdUp8V1vv5ZKehJUOJyhy897oAG1r1ZuIULtornq3Yjnhbe51yrH65hiKPWjqCKSO1nchNx8l9cU-DSyi0HYJw6zAG-JniJIpjbp6WMcMFXpXbzKKvvLrFx18JN6MCxnZ4QIzUOxaMirByZ_es_lTNVUPVi-VCS938m0-69tDONsIPK6ZLxAoe8T2hL55GXUqIg-EbeYnAx-pP4a7bIcl&smid=url-share" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New York Times</a>)</p>
</div>

<span><a href="https://www.axios.com/filings-show-sweetgreen-isnt-profitable-despite-claims-50b4314c-e131-4446-99c9-e59570eaa50a.html?utm_campaign=mb&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning_brew" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sweetgreen’s</a></span><span> financial docs show it wasn’t profitable in each year since 2014, despite it telling reporters that it </span><span><em>was </em></span><span>profitable.</span>

<span><a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/carlieporterfield/2021/10/28/nft-artist-beeples-first-physical-piece-could-fetch-15-million-at-auction/?sh=36328f2662ce" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Beeple</a></span><span>, king of NFTs, will auction off a physical sculpture next month for an estimated $15 million.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span><a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/10/28/tech/activision-blizzard-bobby-kotick-pay-cut/index.html?utm_term=link&utm_source=twCNN&utm_medium=social&utm_content=2021-10-28T20%3A41%3A09" class="link" target="_blank" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Activision Blizzard’s CEO</a></span><span> requested a new salary of $62,500, the minimum California will allow, until the company fixes its discrimination and harassment issues.</span>
</li>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Friday Puzzle
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Place a 3-letter word in the blank spaces to complete a word on the left and begin another word with those letters on the right.<br><br><strong style="color:#000">Example: </strong>e a r _ _ _ m e = earthy and thyme<br><br>1. f e a t _ _ _ o i c <br>2. c o u r _ _ _ n d a <br>3. d i s p _ _ _ o v e r <br>4. k e e _ _ _ s i s t <br>5. r u n _ _ _ i c e </p>
</td>

The US economy grew last quarter at its \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/10/28/us-gross-domestic-product-increases-at-2point0percent-annualized-pace-in-q3-vs-2point8percent-estimate.html?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eslowest pace\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e since the beginning of the recovery last summer—2% annualized. Still, economists expect growth to pick back up this quarter with Covid case counts lower and the worst of the logistics disruptions hopefully behind us.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!-- END MARKETS --\u003e\n\u003c!-- ARTICLE ---\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso ]\u003e\u003c! -- --\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"c6 \" style=\"margin-bottom:7px\"\u003e\n\u003c!-- \u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003cth class=\"card\" style=\"text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px\"\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding: 15px;\"\u003e\n\u003ch3 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nTECH \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/undefined?email={{profile.email}}\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nCould It Have Been Anything Else? \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/28/undefined?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt='Mark Zuckerberg standing in front of a poster that says \"Meta\"' style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://cdn.sanity.io/images/bl383u0v/production/2fcafb9c30836538f9c668bcad0708ce51123633-1873x1054.png?w=670\u0026q=70\u0026auto=format\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFacebook \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAt Facebook’s Connect event yesterday, CEO Mark Zuckerberg said the corporation will \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/facebook-meta-mark-zuckerberg-technology-business-5ad543ab7780caae435935f0aca9fac6?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eswitch its name\u003c/a\u003e to Meta. Why? Because calling the company Facebook is like calling Rihanna a musician—it just doesn’t work anymore.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“Right now, our brand is so tightly linked with one product that it can’t possibly represent everything we’re doing today, let alone in the future,” Zuck said.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eMeta is short for metaverse\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhich has been described by Zuck as “the next chapter of the internet.” The metaverse is a complex topic to describe, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/30/mark-zuckerberg-wants-facebook-become-metaverse-company-mean?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eeven for experts\u003c/a\u003e, but roughly speaking it’s a world where people work, shop, play, and do everything else they normally do IRL—just in digital form.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd if the metaverse is the next chapter of the internet, Zuck wants to write it and leave everyone else in the footnotes.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMeta (slowly getting used to it) is separating out its “Reality Labs” unit, which is home to Oculus and other virtual reality products. The other unit is the Family of Apps (WhatsApp, Instagram, etc.).\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company is spending so much on the metaverse—like hiring 10,000 jobs in Europe to work on it—that its operating profits will take a $10 billion hit this year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow you know it’s real:\u003c/strong\u003e Meta is giving up its ticker FB and going with MVRS on Dec. 1.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eCritics say this is an intentional distraction\u003c/h2\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCompanies throughout history have rebranded when facing public pressure. In 2003, cigarette maker Philip Morris changed its name to Altria to try and shed its reputation as a public health menace.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for Facebook, you could name it Orange Juice Squared and it would still be facing the same threats, such as a recent onslaught of critical reports, Apple’s privacy changes denting its ad business, and, perhaps most significantly, decreasing popularity among young people.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow, Facebook’s problems are Meta’s problems.—\u003cem\u003eNF\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe New Spending Bill: What's In, What's Out \n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cdiv\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe White House on Thursday rolled out a new, personal pan-sized framework for its Build Back Better Act—a spending package that aims to pump heaps of cash into climate, social welfare, and educational programs.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eInitially eyeing a $6 trillion price tag, then $3.5 trillion, Democrats corralled by President Biden have cut the package down to $1.75 trillion after an arduous stretch of negotiations with \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2021/10/27/twitter-amplifies-conservative-politicians/?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emost-likely-to-be-ratioed\u003c/a\u003e Senators Manchin and Sinema. But, contrary to popular belief: The bill does still contain words. So what does Building Back Better currently look like?\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s in:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn additional year \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eof the enhanced child tax credit.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eUniversal pre-K \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003efor more than 6 million 3- and 4-year-olds.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEnvironmental tax credits\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of up to $12,500 for new electric vehicles and incentives for installing solar panels.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s out:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePaid family and medical leave.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Initially 12 weeks were floated, but the proposal has now been entirely cut.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTwo free years of community college.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePrescription drug price decreases.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e Previous versions of the bill would’ve allowed Medicare to negotiate drug prices.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMedicare dental\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e and vision coverage.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/10/26/undefined?utm_campaign=mb\u0026utm_medium=newsletter\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" class=\"link\" target=\"_blank\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBillionaires Income Tax\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s next: \u003c/strong\u003eDemocrats need to receive support from their own caucus to pass the bill in the Senate. House progressives have “enthusiastically endorsed” the new White House framework.—\u003cem\u003eMK\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable
